results.title: The Shame (A)
results.creator_credit: Virginia Moncrieff and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
This program discusses domestic violence and sexual abuse in the Aboriginal communities in regional and outback Australia, where Aboriginal women are fifteen times more likely to be hospitalised and ten times more likely to die from domestic assaults than their white counterparts. There is also a frighteningly high rate of sexual abuse of young Aboriginal children and as Patrick Dodson (Chairman, Reconciliation Council 1991-97) quite poignantly remarks “At stake is the survival of Aboriginal people”. Rather than laying blame, reporter Liz Jackson attempts to find out why domestic abuse is so prevalent and what, if anything, is being done to improve conditions for the Aboriginal communities. Unemployment, alcohol abuse, boredom, low self-esteem, and cultural rituals contribute, it would appear, to the Aboriginal male aggression towards their family, and particularly their wives. Through interviews and personal stories, “The Shame” provides an insight into this most disturbing and tragic situation which exists among the indigenous people of Australia.

results.title: The Shah of Iran's visit to Australia 1974
results.brief_description: Official greeting by the Governor General Sir William Kerr, the Prime Minister and Mrs Whitlam, as well as senior parliamentarians and leading members of the diplomatic corps, mark the beginning of a busy week of engagemnets for the Royal couple through the Eatern states of Australia.

results.title: The Shaggy dog
results.creator_credit: Charles Barton, Bill Walsh, Walt Disney Animation Studios and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Family comedy film around the theme of fantasy and magic. The discovery of a magic ring changed young Wilby Daniels’ (Tommy Kirk) life forever. Suddenly he could transform himself into a large sheepdog - but the problem was he had no control as to when this was going to happen. Wilby did not need this in his life right now, just when he had his eye on the rather pretty Allison (Annette Funicello). He had to break the spell and the only way to do that was by performing some virtuous deed. Cast also includes Fred MacMurray, Jean Hagen, Tim Considine.

results.title: The Shaggy D.A.
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson, Walt Disney Animation Studios and Bill Anderson
results.brief_description: Sequel to Disney’s “The Shaggy Dog” (released 17 years earlier), this family comedy is full of slapstick moments and a plot that takes you from the world of reality to the fantastic and bizarre. Dean Jones stars as the now grown-up Wilby Daniels, who is campaigning to become a district attorney and Keenan Wynn plays his villainous arch-rival, John Slade. The campaign is turned on its head when Daniels is transformed into a sheepdog and Slade into a disgruntled bulldog and it becomes a contest between the two canines. Cast also includes Tim Conway, Suzanne Pleshette, Jo Ann Worley.

results.title: The Shadowers
results.brief_description: This three screen video installation creates a series of disquieting tableaus that present visions of three characters engaged in a game like narrative and whose roles and identities shift and blur between attacker and victim and all that could be the same in between. In an articulation of a ‘schizophrenic understanding of the self’ Tichacek presents an image of oscillating inner world’s where physical and mental experience fluctuate and escape simple definition in the parameters of physical and emotional manipulations and violence (Exhibition proposal). In a thematic echo of and engagement with technological advancements in bodily modification, the victim, played by the artist, is submitted to a range of intrusive and physical molding actions at the hands of the other characters, set in lush outdoor settings as well as in a dark and clinical interior. Suspended in a triangular fashion and surrounding a sculptural object, the viewer can move between and behind the synchronised screens, the physical and psychological shifts of identity featured in the video mirrored in the viewer’s own fluctuating experience of the work as they become variously immersed in or distanced from the disturbingly beautiful and new but fragile ‘prosthetic’ space the game narrative articulates. Static and inarticulate frequencies, or white noise, layer the visuals in place of the characters’ speech and screams and create an aural sense of distortion and displacement for the viewer in the use of surround sound.

results.title: The Shadow Over East Timor
results.creator_credit: Mandy King, James Kesteven and Denis Freney
results.brief_description: In December 1975, 20,000 Indonesian troops invaded East Timor. Australia turned a blind eye and the United States increased its military aid to Indonesia. This conflict is the least reported in modern history and this film brings to light eyewitness accounts of the real events - the massacres, famines, corruption and the resistance that still continues.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mandy King, James Kesteven and Denis Freney

results.title: The Shadow of progress
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, Humphrey Swingler, British Petroleum and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Surveys the problems of exhaustion and destruction of natural resources, pollution and ecological disturbance due to industry, discussing examples of damage to the environment and of constructive counter-measures undertaken around the world.

results.title: The Shadow of ignorance: An inquiry
results.brief_description: Venereal disease in Britain, a programme introduced by Jo Grimmond, M.P. It avoids moral issues, and concentrates on facts: the symptoms of infection, the confidential nature of treatment at a special clinic and the contact slips for patients to give to those who infected them. At the end, three patients are interviewed: a prostitute, a boy and a girl (who talks good sense about parental attitudes). To some extent it will discourage promiscuity; certainly by making it clear that treatment is neither embarrassing nor painful it will encourage those who suspect that they have been infected to seek treatment. Restriction: To be shows to members and students of the medical profession and nursing profession.
